parameters.name: UvRange
parameters.description: Array of 4 doubles indicating the range of the surface to use (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Dir
parameters.description: Array of 3 doubles indicating the direction of projection on the surface (see Remarks)

parameters.name: Angle
parameters.description: Angle relative to dir where to create the curves

parameters.name: CurveCount
parameters.description: Number of curves to create (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Curves
parameters.description: Array of curves of size CurveCount

parameters.name: CurveBounds
parameters.description: Array of doubles of size 2*Curves indicating the parametric bounds of the curve

title: ISurface.IMakeIsoCurves
signature:
System.Boolean IMakeIsoCurves( 
   ref System.Double
UvRange
,
   ref System.Double
Dir
,
   System.Double
Angle
,
   System.Double
Tol
,
   System.Int32
CurveCount
,
   out Curve
Curves
,
   out System.Double
CurveBounds
)

parameters.name: UvRange
parameters.description: Array of 4 doubles indicating the range of the surface to use (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Dir
parameters.description: Array of 3 doubles indicating the direction of projection on the surface (see Remarks)

parameters.name: Angle
parameters.description: Angle relative to dir where to create the curves

parameters.name: CurveCount
parameters.description: Number of curves to create (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Curves
parameters.description: Array of curves of size CurveCount

parameters.name: CurveBounds
parameters.description: Array of doubles of size 2*Curves indicating the parametric bounds of the curve

returns: True if curves are created on the surface, false if not
remarks:
The UvRange argument is an array of 4 doubles indicating the minimum and maximum U and V values:
[
u_min, u_max, v_min, v_max
]
The dir argument is an array of 3 doubles representing the unit vector:
[
x, y, z
]
Before calling this method, call
ISurface::IGetMakeIsoCurvesCount
.
